intro: Kanahia monroi, commonly known as the Hawaiian red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often have a reddish hue. Kanahia monroi thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii.
